image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's opening gambit for 2025 — a year in which an election is due to be held no later than May 17 — underscores the importance of the nation's northern jurisdictions to the coming contest.

title.children: Labor pledges to fund bulk of Bruce Highway upgrades in re-election bid

image.altText: Proxy mum with Alex

props.synopsis: ARFID is a newly recognised eating disorder, which became an official diagnosis for adults and children in 2013. For 12-year-old Alex*, the diagnosis came as a relief after years bouncing around the medical system.

title.children: Eating disorder ARFID is almost as common as anorexia

image.altText: The Australian squad poses for a photo in the SCG change room with the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Ashes trophy and WTC trophy

props.synopsis: A glorious Test series ends with a famous Australian victory, a new Tasmanian hero born and a summer-long triumph that stands as the most significant for Pat Cummins's champion team.

title.children: The defining triumph of the Cummins era comes after one of the greatest Test series

image.altText: Rear view of dad holding her little girl in his arms and looking at their house with installed solar panels.

props.synopsis: An energy-efficient home can save you thousands of dollars in power bills each year, but the initial outlay for solar or batteries is expensive. Luckily, there are a few ways to pay for it.

title.children: Green loans offer cheap option to make houses more efficient

image.altText: A shell in mid-air, immediately after being launched by a grenade launcher with a soldier behind it, with a field behind him.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has occupied a small part of Russia's Kursk region for the last five months, prompting Moscow to deploy North Korean troops there.

title.children: Ukrainian military stages fresh push in Russian territory

image.altText: Graphic of a percentage sign with a downward arrow.

props.synopsis: Will this be the year mortgage borrowers finally get some interest rate relief? That's certainly what many are hoping and forecasting. Here's what you can expect, when, and what it could mean for your mortgage.

title.children: The RBA is expected to cut interest rates this year. Here's what to watch

image.altText: Jordan Thompson sits on his haunches

props.synopsis: Tennis players are playing more often, in more locations around the world than ever before. This "ridiculous" schedule is looming as the sport's biggest threat.

title.children: Tennis players concerned over burnout ahead of Australian Open

image.altText: people walk in front of the angel of the north statue, the ground is covered in snow

props.synopsis: With the weather set to stay inclement on Sunday in the UK, there are concerns that many rural communities, particularly in the north of England, could be cut off.

title.children: Heavy snow causes widespread disruption across England and Europe

image.altText: A child walks at childcare.

props.synopsis: Sydney mother Tasmia Rahman says she is struggling to find her five-month-old son a place in childcare and is concerned her family might have to wait as long as two years on a single income until they find a place.

title.children: Sydney families under budget pressure because of childcare deserts

image.altText: Two Koreans wearing red beanies hold big signs saying 'stop the steal' in giant red letters with an American flag above them

props.synopsis: President Yoon Suk Yeol is waiting out the clock for his arrest, as protesters brave out the snow in the South Korean capital.

title.children: South Korean investigators have one more day to arrest the president

image.altText: The TikTok effect on Antarctica

props.synopsis: Academics say the frivolous nature of some TikTok videos is creating perceptions, and potentially behaviours, that are sometimes at odds with the values of the Antarctic Treaty system.

title.children: Antarctic tourism has 'exploded' and researchers say TikTok is playing a part

image.altText: Surf lifesaving recruits carrying rescue boards.

props.synopsis: A new generation of lifesavers will hit the beach this summer, as Australians are urged to heed warnings and swim between the flags.

title.children: A new generation of lifesavers hope to reverse a rising drowning toll

image.altText: A young woman with short brown hair smiling at the camera holding up an old style flip phone.

props.synopsis: You've had a break from social media over the holidays, but what about a more permanent reset of your relationship with your devices? These digital minimalists did just that.

title.children: 'Digital minimalism' can help you spend less time on your phone in 2025

image.altText: A shot of an outback city taken from a hill with an orange sky in the background.

props.synopsis: Geoscience Australia says a string of three earthquakes near the outback mining city is unusual and that it's likely they are unrelated.

title.children: Three earthquakes hit Broken Hill region in less than two days

image.altText: Two horses finish neck to neck on the finish line.

props.synopsis: One of the world's richest horse race meetings — the final day of the Gold Coast Magic Millions — is scheduled to run in six days, but the venue is still up in the air after "discolouration" to the track.

title.children: 'No way' Magic Millions track damage was a protest, activist says

image.altText: An old pic of a man and a young girl holding a fish on the water

props.synopsis: Sixty-three-year-old Tony Andeliero's fishing boat was found floating unattended on Friday. The search is expected to resume on Monday pending weather conditions.

title.children: Wind delays search for missing fisherman off NSW Illawarra coast

image.altText: Virat Kohli appears to mock Australia's infamous ball-tampering scandal, turning out his pockets

props.synopsis: India superstar Virat Kohli seemingly mocks the ball-tampering saga that curtailed Steve Smith's career.

title.children: Kohli appears to mock Australia's infamous 'sandpapergate'

image.altText: Swimmers in water at Penrith Beach

props.synopsis: How hot is too hot? The answer, according to leading heat health experts, can change dramatically based on the complex interactions between environmental factors in different postcodes.

title.children: Heat risk is complex and your postcode could be the determining factor

image.altText: A white middle-aged man with closely cropped white hair speaks into two microphones

props.synopsis: Ann Telnaes says her editor prevented her from holding power to account by refusing to publish a cartoon showing tech giants bowing to the US president-elect.

title.children: Washington Post cartoonist resigns over rejected cartoon featuring owner Jeff Bezos

image.altText: Team USA pose with the United Cup trophy.

props.synopsis: Coco Gauff and Taylor Fritz complete their assignment, winning both singles matches to seal victory for the US over Poland in the United Cup final.

title.children: Gauff, Fritz deliver US second United Cup triumph after beating Poland in final

image.altText: A man with a red face and a cap in front of a series of red concentric circles and white squiggly lines

props.synopsis: A succession of foreshocks and aftershocks are reshaping the geopolitical landscape. How will the global politics of 2025 be defined?

title.children: Tectonic events are reshaping global politics

image.altText: A group of firefighters discuss their tactics.

props.synopsis: High temperatures and unsettled weather could trigger dry lightning across Victoria on Sunday, as the state continues to swelter.

title.children: 'Tricky conditions' for firefighters as Victoria's heatwave continues

image.altText: A woman in Muslim dress with her hand on her forehead, looking shocked at a mound of rubble after an air strike

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden informs Congress of an $US8 billion ($13 billion) arms sale to Israel, according to US officials.

title.children: US plans $13 billion arms sale to Israel, US officials say

image.altText: Three young Indigenous men stand next to timber poles

props.synopsis: More than one in every 20 Wadeye residents is in jail, making it one of the most incarcerated communities in Australia.

title.children: In one of Australia's most imprisoned areas, some are breaking the cycle

image.altText: A green car dangles its front over the edge of a collapsed bridge.

props.synopsis: Frank Manley remembers driving his family home across the Tasman Bridge at night but ahead of him the line markings disappeared into a dark abyss.

title.children: Fifty years on, Frank still avoids driving over the Tasman Bridge

image.altText: A white middle-aged man with white hair speaks to media with his hands open looking serious

props.synopsis: Karl Nehammer says he will resign as Austrian leader after coalition talks to form a government excluding the leading far-right party collapsed.

title.children: Austrian chancellor steps down as coalition talks collapse

image.altText: A mugshot of a bearded man in glasses

props.synopsis: Harold Shipman is suspected of killing more than 250 people over two decades. How did he get away with it for so long?

title.children: 'Unparalleled in history': Britain's worst serial killer murdered 250 people

image.altText: back of a large navy blue oil tanker that reads eagle s in white lettering

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has a collection of hundreds of rusting tankers covertly carrying Russian crude oil around the world, according to the European Union.

title.children: Russia's 'shadow fleet' could be sabotaging key EU infrastructure

image.altText: Half a plane washed up on a beach

props.synopsis: Authorities recover the bodies of two men who died in a plane crash off Nambucca Heads on the Coffs Harbour coast yesterday.

title.children: Two bodies recovered after light plane crash off NSW coast

image.altText: two young girls sitting on a rock looking out into the sunset with classes of wine

props.synopsis: When you think of summer holidays, it is easy to picture bustling beaches and busy shopping centres. But the outback's hibernation boasts a different, much quieter scene.

title.children: Outback towns enter hibernation amid exodus for summer tourist hotspots

image.altText: A politician wearing a suit jacket, speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Criminal gangs have become involved in the sale of illicit tobacco and illegal vapes despite numerous police raids, according to the Queensland government.

title.children: Government warns of vape sale gangs as opposition calls out budget delay

image.altText: An illustration of a mother and two young children in a car, representing a family fleeing family violence.

props.synopsis: The housing crisis is having devastating impacts on the domestic violence sector, with women having fewer options for leaving and homelessness shelters filling up.

title.children: Packed homeless shelters leave women and children stranded

image.altText: a man appears relieved in his surf ski

props.synopsis: Rowers are celebrating after crossing the finish line in Eden of what is considered to be the toughest and longest surfboat race in the world.

title.children: Rowers battle blisters to finish gruelling seven-day George Bass race

image.altText: police officers and SES volunteers stand next to police vehicles on a cliff next to a beach

props.synopsis: Police have concluded a search for surfer Lance Appleby, who was killed in a shark attack in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Search ends for surfer attacked by shark as fundraiser soars past $80k
